question: A B-Tree of order m stores keys in each internal node. Which of the following statements is always true?
options: All leaves are at the same depth
Each internal node contains at most m children and at least m children
answer: All leaves are at the same depth

question: In a directed graph, edges represent dependencies between tasks. You are told the graph contains exactly one cycle. Which of the following is necessarily true?
options: BFS tree will contain the cycle
All nodes in the cycle have equal indegree
Removing any node of the cycle makes it acyclic
Removing any one edge of the cycle makes the graph acyclic
answer: Removing any one edge of the cycle makes the graph acyclic

question: A dependency graph contains exactly one directed cycle, while all other parts are acyclic. Which statement is necessarily always true?
options: Every node in the cycle has at least two incoming edges
Removing any single node from the cycle will break all cycles in the graph
Removing any single edge that is part of the cycle will make the entire graph acyclic
Performing BFS from any node in the cycle will detect the cycle immediately
answer: Removing any single edge that is part of the cycle will make the entire graph acyclic

question: In which of the following scenarios is a linked list preferred over an array?
Consider a BST. Which of the following sequences CANNOT be the postorder traversal of a BST?
You are given a max-heap and you want to find the k-th largest element. Which approach guarantees the best worst-case complexity?
options: Convert heap to array and sort
Use a min-heap of size k
Modify the heap into a BST
answer: Use a min-heap of size k

question: A road network graph contains negative edges but no negative cycles. Which shortest-path algorithm guarantees correctness?
options: Dijkstra’s algorithm, because it efficiently handles weighted graphs
BFS, because it explores nodes level by level
Bellman–Ford, because it correctly handles negative weights in graphs without negative cycles
Floyd–Warshall, because it is optimal for directed acyclic graphs
answer: Bellman–Ford, because it correctly handles negative weights in graphs without negative cycles

question: A search engine must support fast auto-suggestions based on prefixes. Which data structure is MOST appropriate?
options: Hash table, because it stores strings efficiently
Trie (Prefix Tree), because it supports fast prefix search in O(L) time, where L is length of prefix
Balanced BST, because it maintains sorted strings
Heap, because it retrieves highest priority queries first
answer: Trie (Prefix Tree), because it supports fast prefix search in O(L) time, where L is length of prefix

question: A dynamic array doubles its size when full. A student claims insertion at the end is slow due to O(n) resizing. Using amortized analysis, evaluate this claim.
options: The student is correct; insertion always takes O(n)
The student is incorrect; although resizing is O(n), most inserts are O(1), giving amortized O(1) time per insert
The student is correct only when array remains full
Insertion cost is unpredictable and cannot be analyzed
answer: The student is incorrect; although resizing is O(n), most inserts are O(1), giving amortized O(1) time per insert

question: Which data structure should a compiler use to check well-formed nested parentheses, braces, and brackets?
options: Queue, because it ensures FIFO ordering
Stack, because it ensures last-in, first-out matching needed for nested structures
Graph, because it can store multiple types of edges
Hash table, because it supports constant-time lookup
answer: Stack, because it ensures last-in, first-out matching needed for nested structures

question: What is the output of the following code? arr = [2, 5, 8, 11, 14, 17]; result = []; for x in arr: if x % 2 == 0: result.append(x*x); print(result)
What is printed? x = [[1,2],[3,4]]; y = x; y[0][1] = 99; print(x)
What does the following code print? compute(2,3,10,20,x=1,y=2)
What will this dictionary comprehension print? new = {k: v*2 for k,v in data.items() if v % 2 == 1}
What is printed by this code involving exception handling? try: x = 5/0; except ZeroDivisionError: print('Error occurred'); finally: print('Done')
What is the result of tuple unpacking? a, b, *c = [10,20,30,40,50]
What is printed regarding string immutability? s='hello'; t=s; s=s+' world'; print(t)
What is the result of the set comprehension? {x*x for x in nums if x % 2 == 1}
Does the following code avoid the mutable default argument bug? def append_item(x, lst=[]): if lst==[]: lst=[]; lst.append(x); return lst
options: The code is correct; each call creates a new list
The code is still incorrect; the default list persists across calls
This code works only if integers are used
answer: The code is still incorrect; the default list persists across calls

question: Does this code print 20? x=10; def fun(x): x=x+10; return x; print(fun(x))
A machine fails today with probability 0.08. If it fails today, it fails tomorrow with probability 0.3; otherwise with 0.08. What is the probability it fails tomorrow?
A committee of 4 is to be formed from 7 teachers and 5 students. At least 2 teachers must be included. How many committees are possible?
E(t)=t^3−6t^2+9t+4. At what value of t is maximum efficiency reached?
For what value of k does the system 2x+4y=6k and x+2ky=3k have infinitely many solutions?
Determine the nature of solutions of: 3x+6y=12 and x+2y=4.
Solve using elimination: 2x−y=14 and x+y=11
Are the vectors u=(2,−1,1), v=(1,2,−2) orthogonal?
A drone chooses 1 of 10 routes each day; 3 pass through a turbulence zone. For 7 days, what is the probability it encounters turbulence at least once?
Let A = {f(x)=ax+b | a>0, a,b ∈ Z} and B = {f(x)=mx+n | m is even}. What is A ∩ B?
options: All linear functions with positive, even slope
answer: All linear functions with positive, even slope

question: For which value of k is the matrix [[k,2],[3,6]] singular?
